content: The Act may be cited as the "Congressional Pension Forfeiture Act" and pertains to the conviction of certain offenses. The Congressional Pension Forfeiture Act amends Section 8312(a) of title 5, United States Code, to include forfeiture of pension for individuals convicted of specific offenses listed in subsection (d). It also identifies these offenses and specifies the period of forfeiture after conviction. The Congressional Pension Forfeiture Act amends Section 8312(a) of title 5, United States Code to include forfeiture of pension for individuals convicted of specific offenses listed in subsection (d). These offenses apply to individuals who were Members of Congress or Congressional employees at the time of committing the offense and are punishable by imprisonment for more than one year. The offenses include bribery of public officials, compensation to Members of Congress, officers, and others in matters affecting the Government.
